as you learn more as it will help to keep you on track, avoid distractions, and develop the actual
model that you need for your project.
2.2 Inputs vs. Outputs
Generally, a prediction problem involves using past observations to predict or forecast one or
more possible future observations. The goal is to guess about what might happen in the future.
